alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 28 at 4:12PM AKST until March 01 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches from the Hope Cutoff to Seward and 6 to 12 inches for Whittier, Portage, and Turnagain Pass. East winds gusting as high as 45 mph through Portage Valley through early morning Wednesday. North winds gusting to 50 mph around Seward Wednesday morning. Reduced visibility as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Portage Valley, eastern Turnagain Arm, and Seward. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will continue to increase through Portage Valley and eastern Turnagain Arm, peaking tonight and persisting into early Wednesday morning. As the area of low pressure passes east of Seward early Wednesday morning, northerly winds will quickly increase, peaking mid-morning Wednesday before slowly diminishing late Wednesday afternoon. Snow will likely be fluffy and windy conditions will significantly reduce visibility and create snow drifts. Gusty winds in Portage Valley and Whittier will shift to the west Wednesday afternoon and persist through Thursday. Blowing snow and reduced visibilities are likely to continue for these locations through Thursday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
